required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Two New Generation Dressings in Intensive Care (ADVANCED)
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison Between Two Types of Semipermeable Dressings of New Generation in the Prevention of Intravascular Catheters Related Complications in Intensive Care.

brief_summary.textblock: Intravascular devices in intensive care units are often associated to complications. The investigators estimate that 23.5% of catheters placed and used in intensive care are subject to at least one complication; the investigators goal is to demonstrate the effectiveness of the new Tegaderm ™ IV Advanced dressings to achieve a decrease of 35% in the number of complications associated with intravascular catheters in intensive care.

detailed_description.textblock: randomized controlled trial of 2 intravascular dressings in Intensive care unit

primary_outcome.measure: Number of catheters presenting any kind of complications..
primary_outcome.time_frame: From the insertion of the catheter to its removal, an average time frame thant can go up to 4 weeks.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of catheter infections related to poor adherent dressings.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From the insertion of the catheter to its removal, an average time frame thant can go up to 4 weeks

other_outcome.measure: Number of participants presenting allergic adverse events
other_outcome.time_frame: From the insertion of the catheter to its removal, an average time frame thant can go up to 4 weeks.

other_outcome.measure: Costs of each dressing type strategy.
other_outcome.time_frame: From the insertion of the catheter to its removal, an average time frame thant can go up to 4 weeks.

arm_group.description: Control group: depending on the type of dressing available at the hospital, either 3M™ HP Dressing or Smith & Nephew IV3000 ™

intervention.description: Patients were assigned to either arm following a randomization scheme 1:1.
intervention.other_name: 3M™ HP Dressing or Smith & Nephew IV3000 ™

intervention.description: Patients were assigned to either arm following a randomization scheme 1:1.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients over 18 years with a central venous catheter, an arterial catheter, a hemodialysis catheter, a Swan Ganz catheter or a peripheral catheter inserted in the ICU or within the 24 before their arrival at the ICU in another ICU setting.
- Patients benefiting from the social security protection.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients under 18 years of age,
- Patients having known allergy or sensitivity to adhesive dressing materials
